name: dart-math
comment: Mathematical constants and functions, plus a random number generator.

E.name: E
E.comment:
Base of the natural logarithms.

Typically written as "e".

log.name: log
log.comment: Converts dart-math.log.x to a double and returns the natural logarithm of the value. Returns negative infinity if dart-math.log.x is equal to zero. Returns NaN if dart-math.log.x is NaN or less than zero.

exp.name: exp
exp.comment: Converts dart-math.exp.x to a double and returns the natural exponent, dart-math.E, to the power dart-math.exp.x. Returns NaN if dart-math.exp.x is NaN.

sqrt.name: sqrt
sqrt.comment:
Converts dart-math.sqrt.x to a double and returns the positive square root of the value.

Returns -0.0 if dart-math.sqrt.x is -0.0, and NaN if dart-math.sqrt.x is otherwise negative or NaN.

atan.name: atan
atan.comment: Converts dart-math.atan.x to a dobule and returns the arc tangent of the vlaue. Returns a value in the range -PI/2..PI/2, or NaN if dart-math.atan.x is NaN.

asin.name: asin
asin.comment: Converts dart-math.asin.x to a double and returns the arc sine of the value. Returns a value in the range -PI..PI, or NaN if dart-math.asin.x is outside the range -1..1.

acos.name: acos
acos.comment:
Converts dart-math.acos.x to a double and returns the arc cosine of the value.

Returns a value in the range -PI..PI, or NaN if dart-math.acos.x is outside the range -1..1.

tan.name: tan
tan.comment:
Converts dart-math.tan.x to a double and returns the tangent of the value.

The tangent function is equivalent to sin(x)/cos(x) and may be infinite (positive or negative) when cos(x) is equal to zero. If dart-math.tan.x is not a finite number, the result is NaN.

cos.name: cos
cos.comment:
Converts dart-math.cos.x to a double and returns the cosine of the value.

If dart-math.cos.x is not a finite number, the result is NaN.

sin.name: sin
sin.comment:
Converts dart-math.sin.x to a double and returns the sine of the value.

If dart-math.sin.x is not a finite number, the result is NaN.

pow.name: pow
pow.comment:
Returns dart-math.pow.x to the power of dart-math.pow.exponent.

If dart-math.pow.x is an dart-core.int and dart-math.pow.exponent is a non-negative dart-core.int, the result is an dart-core.int, otherwise both arguments are converted to doubles first, and the result is a dart-core.double.

For integers, the power is always equal to the mathematical result of x to the power exponent, only limited by the available memory.

For doubles, pow(x, y) handles edge cases as follows:

  • if y is zero (0.0 or -0.0), the result is always 1.0.
  • if x is 1.0, the result is always 1.0.
  • otherwise, if either x or y is NaN then the result is NaN.

  • if x is negative (but not -0.0) and y is a finite non-integer, the result is NaN.

  • if x is Infinity and y is negative, the result is 0.0.
  • if x is Infinity and y is positive, the result is Infinity.
  • if x is 0.0 and y is negative, the result is Infinity.
  • if x is 0.0 and y is positive, the result is 0.0.

  • if x is -Infinity or -0.0 and y is an odd integer, then the result is -pow(-x ,y).

  • if x is -Infinity or -0.0 and y is not an odd integer, then the result is the same as pow(-x , y).

  • if y is Infinity and the absolute value of x is less than 1, the result is 0.0.

  • if y is Infinity and x is -1, the result is 1.0.

  • if y is Infinity and the absolute value of x is greater than 1, the result is Infinity.

  • if y is -Infinity, the result is 1/pow(x, Infinity).

This corresponds to the pow function defined in the IEEE Standard 754-2008.

Notice that an dart-core.int result cannot overflow, but a dart-core.double result might be dart-core.double.INFINITY.

atan2.name: atan2
atan2.comment:
A variant of dart-math.atan.

Converts both arguments to doubles.

Returns the angle between the positive x-axis and the vector (dart-math.atan2.b,dart-math.atan2.a). The result, in radians, is in the range -PI..PI.

If dart-math.atan2.b is positive, this is the same as atan(b/a).

The result is negative when dart-math.atan2.a is negative (including when dart-math.atan2.a is the double -0.0).

If dart-math.atan2.a is equal to zero, the vector (dart-math.atan2.b,dart-math.atan2.a) is considered parallel to the x-axis, even if dart-math.atan2.b is also equal to zero. The sign of dart-math.atan2.b determines the direction of the vector along the x-axis.

Returns NaN if either argument is NaN.

max.name: max
max.comment:
Returns the larger of two numbers.

Returns NaN if either argument is NaN. The larger of -0.0 and 0.0 is 0.0. If the arguments are otherwise equal (including int and doubles with the same mathematical value) then it is unspecified which of the two arguments is returned.

min.name: min
min.comment:
Returns the lesser of two numbers.

Returns NaN if either argument is NaN. The lesser of -0.0 and 0.0 is -0.0. If the arguments are otherwise equal (including int and doubles with the same mathematical value) then it is unspecified which of the two arguments is returned.

class.name: MutableRectangle
class.preview: A class for representing two-dimensional axis-aligned rectangles with mutable properties.

class.name: Rectangle
class.preview: A class for representing two-dimensional rectangles whose properties are immutable.

class.name: Random
class.preview: A generator of random bool, int, or double values.

class.name: Point
class.preview: A utility class for representing two-dimensional positions.
